Operations Manager Job at Cavista




        
    

        
        Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world’s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are searching for an Operations Manager to manage the daily operations of Cavista Technologies.
	This role will ensure the business is well-coordinated and productive by managing its processes, facilities, resources, and people.
	The area of responsibility for this role is wide and requires strong knowledge of various operational processes, including procurement, inventory management, and facility management. 


Responsibilities


	Deliver operational excellence by managing daily operations to support the business.
	Oversee procurement activities, ensuring timely sourcing, vendor engagement, and cost-effective purchasing of goods and services.
	Manage inventory operations, ensuring accurate tracking, replenishment, and optimal stock levels across the organization.
	Lead facility management operations, ensuring a safe, functional, and well-maintained work environment.
	Collaborate with management in the development of performance goals and long-term operational plans.
	Manage operational processes and performance and recommend improvement solutions.?? 
	Implement and monitor day-to-day operational systems and processes that provide visibility into goals, progress, and obstacles for our key initiatives.?? 
	Nurture and maintain relationships with leaders, external partners, vendors, and suppliers to support operational activity and strategic goals.
	Plan, monitor, and analyze key metrics for the day-to-day performance of operations to ensure efficient and timely completion of tasks.?? 


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related field.
	7 - 10 years of operational experience required.
	Master's Degree is a plus.
	Experience in technology or healthcare industry a plus.
	In-depth knowledge of multiple operational functions and principles, including finance, customer service, and team development.
	Proven ability to plan and manage operational processes for maximum efficiency and productivity.
	Demonstrated ability to solve problems and anticipate operational and customer needs through effective communication.
	Demonstrable proficiency with technology to include Microsoft office tools.
	Ability to work effectively in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment?.? 
	Strong organizational skills with the ability to set priorities and manage multiple tasks.


What We Offer


	Competitive Compensation.
	5 - day workweek.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs.
	Employee Training Programs.
	Growth and Development.
	Mentoring and Counseling.
	Referral Bonus.

General Dentist Job at Zoom36 Dental Care




        
    

        
        Zoom36 Dental Care is a leading dental services provider in Nigeria, offering a comprehensive range of high-quality treatments to enhance and maintain oral health.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Dentist

Job Location: Lagos

Job Responsibilities
Patient Care & Treatment:
     

            
    




	Perform comprehensive oral exams, diagnose conditions, and create treatment plans.
	Provide advanced procedures: root canals, crowns, bridges, implants, extractions, fillings, cosmetic treatments.
	Manage complex cases, including patients with disabilities or medical complexities.
	Administer anesthesia and prescribe medications.
	
		Review staff reports and evaluate treatment outcomes.
		Contribute to service development and implementation of clinical standards.
	
	


Quality & Compliance:


	Maintain high standards of infection control, hygiene, and regulatory compliance.
	Accurately document patient records, treatment plans, and follow-ups.
	Participate in audits and quality improvement initiatives.


Patient Education & Communication:


	Educate patients on oral hygiene, preventive care, and treatment options.
	Collaborate with other healthcare professionals for comprehensive care.


Professional Development:


	Stay updated on new technologies, techniques, and research.
	Participate in continuous training, appraisals, and personal development planning. 


Key Skills & Qualification


	Extensive clinical experience, often including experience with complex or special needs patients.
	Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail, steady hand-eye coordination, and problem-solving abilities.
	Proficiency with digital imaging, dental software, and potentially telehealth platforms. 


Salary Range
N500,000 - N750,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: jobs.zoomexclusivedentals@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.
